meanings.definition: Bluntness or abruptness in manner or speech.
meanings.sent1: Her brusquerie in the meeting made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: I was taken aback by his brusquerie when I asked a simple question.
meanings.sent3: Despite his brusquerie, he always means well.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's brusquerie was like a sharp slap to the students' confidence.
meanings.sent5: The brusquerie of the storm took us by surprise.

meanings.sent1: She responded with brusquerie when asked about her plans.
meanings.sent2: His brusquerie often led to misunderstandings with his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The cat's brusquerie towards the dog was comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The brusquerie of the email left a bitter taste in her mouth.
meanings.sent5: The brusquerie of the customer service agent was off-putting.

meanings.sent1: His brusquerie was a result of his impatience.
meanings.sent2: The brusquerie of her tone indicated she was in a hurry.
meanings.sent3: Despite the brusquerie of his words, he meant no harm.
meanings.sent4: The brusquerie of the situation left no room for pleasantries.
meanings.sent5: The brusquerie of the chef's instructions made the dish turn out perfectly.
